headline: It's all shiny on the outside, but quite gloomy on the inside
pros: Initially it looks good and the business concept by the founders are good, but that's the only good thing I could think of
cons:
Extreme work pressure. Work-life balance is almost non-existent. And the pressure is mostly for the mess managers create. 

Management is in a complete mess. For a startup as well-known as Udaan, they sure have dirty politics like the MNCs. Lot of favoritism. The company and the leaders leading the company have a tendency to favor brand over actual work. If you have ever worked in Flipkart, you can rest assured you will be in regardless of whether you know how to work or not. 

These guys even poach people from Flipkart. Offer them double or triple the current salary and get them in and all this because one of the founders is from Flipkart.

Lots of mismanagement by the guys supposed to be good at managing. Managers just want to shake the blame off their shoulders. 

Now coming to the real concern, right now there's a pandemic going on. Every Govt has requested companies to bring in employees ONLY if the nature of their work requires them to be in the office premises.

These guys are experts at finding loopholes in the laws. They are requiring even the people from containment zones to come. No social distancing is mainted in the meeting rooms. 

No regard for human lives. It's a money minting machine, they just want people to give up their lives to churn out money for meager amounts.

If you're thinking about coming here, please consider other options. Udaan is only shiny on the outside, but absolutely worthless on the inside.
